ActorBlueprint.description: Describes how to build an IActor

Ref.description: Inherit all properties from another blueprint of the same type.  This must either exactly match the Name of the other blueprint or match the Identifier guid

Identifier.description: Uniquely identifies instances created from this blueprint

Faction.description:
Null if the object thematically fits any faction, otherwise the  of the faction.
If null and there are multiple factions, a random faction will be chosen for this blueprint unless  flag is set

Unaligned.description: Ensures that the room has no Faction.  This flag overrides Faction and suppresses any random faction assignment processes.

Unique.description: True to only ever generate one of this thing

Name.description: Explicit name for this object.  For actors this can be left null to generate a random name from the faction

InjurySystem.description: Injury system of any FightAction the blueprint spawns (and for IActor the innate weapons of the actor (leave null to use the IsDefault)

Dialogue.description: Things the object has to say e.g. when a creature is talked to or a room examined

OptionalAdjectives.description: List of IAdjective from which to pick at random when creating.  These can be either Guids, Names or Type names

MandatoryAdjectives.description: By default a subset of OptionalAdjectives are written to the objects created by this blueprint (e.g. depending on difficulty, luck etc). Set those that MUST always be added. These can be either Guids, Names or Type names

Stats.description: The BaseStats to give the object

SkipDefaultActions.description: True to make Actions the only actions to be given to the object (i.e. no default actions)

Actions.description: Option, if specified this list becomes the actions of the object replacing any existing actions they might otherwise get)

SkipDefaultBehaviours.description: True to make Behaviours the only behaviours to be given to the object (i.e. no default behaviours)

Behaviours.description: Optional list of behaviours (event handlers) that should be created on the object

Slots.description:
Optional, overrides the default slots (1 head, 2 arms etc) that an actor
would normally have

MandatoryItems.description: MandatoryItems which the actor must be carrying when created

FightVerb.description:
The word that describes how the actor fights when not
equipped with a weapon e.g. fisticuffs

OptionalItems.description: Items which the actor may be carrying when created

OnPush.description: Event handler to trigger on the the behaviour whenever an action is put on the stack

OnPop.description: Event handler to trigger on the the behaviour whenever an action begins successful resolution (the action stack was pushed and nobody removed it from the stack before resolution)

OnRoundEnding.description: Event handler to call after the player has taken an action and all other world actors have responded and the round is ending

OnEnter.description: Event handler to call when any actor performs the LeaveAction and successfully enters a new room.  Note that this gets called for every person in the worlds population that moves not just the behaviour's owner

BehaviourEventHandlerBlueprint.description: Describes how to build a BehaviourEventHandler for a given event on a Behaviour e.g. IRoom)

Condition.description: Pre conditions to check when the event occurs before launching off the Effect.  If multiple conditions are specified then all must be met

Effect.description: Things that should happen when the event handler occurs and the Condition are met e.g. cause damage to someone, launch some dialogue etc

ConditionBlueprint.description: Blueprint that describes how to build one or more ICondition

Lua.description: Lua code that returns true or false

Has.description: Pass a Guid or Name of something they might have, if they have it then the condition is met

HasNot.description: Pass a Guid or Name of something.  As long as they don't have it this condition is true

Stat.description: Arithmetic expression for a required stat they must have e.g. "Fight > 50"
